name: RiverPlace Hotel, a Kimpton Hotel

reviews.text: Visited Portland for a family wedding and stayed 5 nites. The staff, from front desk (especially Jackie), to bellmen and concierge (all the guys: sorry if I forget anyone, Douglas, Daniel, Tracy). Like a ritz or 4 seasons, everybody went out of their way to learn our names and enhance our stay. We did find the rooms a bit small for the price, and switched out for a jr. Suite. They were very full during this time, so I Thank good old Dad for giving up his jr. Suite and taking our small double queen room. The rooms were clean and maid service good. The restaurant was good, and the staff- from manager to server, went out of their way to accommodate our demanding and partying group. God bless em all, especially the manager, whose name escapes me at the moment. I had the best lamb dish in quite awhile. Be warned, though: if you are in a hurry no restaurant on the river walk is fast. We waited quite awhile for our food at the 3 defers, river place, and mccormick down the walk a quarter mile. Both were very good, but slow to get the food out, and mccormick was very slow to seat us. We noticed they allow pets, and that there was never a wait for an elevator. The fruit infused water in the lobby was a nice touch, very refreshing. Last, the bed: gave me a sore lower back. I m not exactly sure why, but I noticed it after we switched to the jr. Suite.
reviews.title: Nice place, great staff, a bit pricey, but location/location/location!

reviews.text: The room was comfortable, the staff was terrific, the hotel had all the amenities I needed and the hotel is well-located for my recent 12-day stay in Portland.
reviews.title: Comfortable, well-located all amenities
"Not A Good Hotel For Business Travelers"
reviews.text: Had to make a same day afternoon cancellation for business reasons and was charged full price of the room. I had stayed at the hotel previously and my colleagues had stayed there many times. Didn't matter. Don't expect to be cut any slack for last minute changes even if your company is a good customer.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service at this hotel was superb. We decided to stay here on our wedding night before taking off for our honeymoon the next day. Unfortunately the bed in the room we stay in was unacceptable. It felt like you were in a hammock when you laid down on it. Head and feet higher then your body. If it hadn't been so late at night we would have asked to change rooms.
reviews.title: Service was wonderful. The bed, not so much.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel just make sure to test out the bed before going to sleep to make sure it is acceptable.
reviews.title: A terrific Boutique Hotel

reviews.text: What a wonderful stay we had at the RiverPlace Hotel. The service was phenomenal. The location was ideal. The fitness club down the block was the best we have ever used. The chocolate chp cookies, flavored water, turn-down chocolates were nice touches. Free wi-fi and coffee. Absolutely no complaints which is unusual for us! Obviously highly recommended.
reviews.title: A great hotel
River view but eccentric
reviews.text: Must see/do: Saturday market, rose gardens, voodoo donuts (go early when the lines are short), pioneer square market, jake's fish restaurant (the dungenous crab was awesome).

reviews.title: This hotel lived up to its billing

reviews.text: Very friendly city.
reviews.title: Beautiful and comfortable, service is stellar

reviews.title: A Great Hotel with Spectacular Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'll always compare everyone to the Riverplace staff. Granted, I live on the east coast, I'll give you that, but truly, Riverplace's service was an unprecedented walk through heaven.
reviews.title: Amazing Service! Amazing!

reviews.text: Two weeks prior to arrival I called the staff daily with anxious inquiries on how to accommodate my sister's memorial service for my family at Riverplace. My sister just died, so sometimes my calls were a messy heap of emotion loaded with off hand questions about room features, and details most people don't care about. Melissa in catering/events was a marvelous advisor; warm, creative, friendly, and positive. She even repeated herself when I had trouble listening or retaining all her information, she stayed professional, thorough, and kind. I followed her advice to book a residential suite with an amazing riverview and balcony, and could not be happier with how it serviced my family gathering to honor my late sister. Room 512 rocks.
reviews.title: Worth the Price

reviews.text: Every one in the front desk was fabulously kind, accommodating, pleasant, timely, responsive, and sensitive. Our several requests, many unconventional, were handled by the front desk family with consistent dedication to staying on task with a shining attitude and fast delivery.
reviews.title: It's a great hotel

reviews.text: 20 minutes after asking for the room to be cleaned, the head of housekeeping and several lovely folks showed up and scoured through there in minutes, knowing a group were on their way in an hour.
reviews.title: More Like Home than most hotels

reviews.text: Get this: I've left expensive items in hotel rooms a few times. No one's admitted they found it, so my stuff became a part of many hotel staff's at-home collection I'm sure. Anyway, reservations emailed to say they found a Nintendo DS in the room and verified our mailing address to send it! How in the world is there a friendly group in a lucrative industry that's, ahem, HONEST?!!! Love them.
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay at a great hotel

reviews.text: My daughter, granddaughter, and I stayed her at the end of June while doing a girls getaway throughout the northwest. I unfortunately had a very bad sinus infection upon arrival and everyone there did their best to get us in our room quickly and give us anything we needed. They were so kind to me, told my daughter to concentrate on making me comfortable, and that they would handle everything else. Not many hotels go this far and are concerned more about their guests than worrying about the check out time. Fortunately, some meds and a good nights sleep made me feel a lot better and I was actually able to enjoy the beauty of RiverPlace. Our room was fabulous, we were in a townhouse suite which gave us lots of room to spread out and had a lovely balcony for enjoying the river. The front desk made great suggestions for spending the day touring Portland and had no problems with us leaving our car and luggage until late in the day. We stayed here because of the reviews from TripAdvisor and I am so glad we did. This is a great hotel that lives up to all the accolates! Thanks for a wonderful time!!
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel with an amazing staff!

reviews.text: My friend and I wanted a gals three-night downtown visit to Portland and this hotel was perfectly situated. The hotel is on the riverfront a few minutes walk to most everything--but we like walking so 5-15-30 minutes to this or that like the art gallery is no big deal for us. There is also a free! shuttle tram you can take with a stop about a three minute walk from the hotel, just ask the hotel staff for directions.
reviews.title: Perfect place for us in every way!

reviews.text: The staff by the way were exceptionally friendly, self-described "individual concierges" and they recommended a fabulous place for breakfast about a 15 minute walk away--Mother's--and a great dinner/jazz club--Jimmy Mak's(not sure of spelling). But you don't have to go far for great food, either, if you just want to hang by the hotel, because their Three Degrees Bar & Grill serves excellent fare & happy hour is a great deal to save some cash. Almost everyplace in Portland seems to have some sort of happy hour for not just drinks but food as well!
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was of a good size for the two of us with a king sized bed. We would have preferred two queens but they were all taken. The bed by the way, was something I've never experienced before--a sort of cloud 9 down softness but with the required support deep down underneath; very sumptuous indeed. At first I thought it would be way too squishy soft but it worked and we had great sleeps there. Our room was extremely & beautifully quiet, on the "garden" side (absolutely no view though, except of grass & the building wall opposite).
reviews.title: Best Pet Friendly Hotel

reviews.text: There was a mini fridge & coffee/tea setup, but I can't recall if there was anything else ie microwave or not.
reviews.title: great stay

description: Stay Tranquil. A landmark presence on the riverfront, RiverPlace Hotel - a Kimpton Hotel, captures the innovative essence and intimate hospitality of the Pacific Northwest. A haven of warmth and tranquility, RiverPlace is a charming refuge located at the base of Portland’s city center. Stay closely connected or blissfully removed – RiverPlace is an immersion in care, comfort and quality. The hotel offers personalized experiences tailored to guest’s individual needs and interests, from complimentary wireless high speed Internet, DVD players and complimentary access to the Oregon Athletic Club at RiverPlace. Guests also enjoy our Three Degrees Waterfront Bar & Grill, one of the city's most popular spots. Everything about this restaurant feels welcoming and comfortable - including our guests.
